name: FireDrum Email Marketing
author: FireDrum Email Marketing

sections.description: The FireDrum Email Marketing plugin allows you to quickly and easily add an opt-in form for your FireDrum Email Marketing list.
sections.installation:
1. Upload the plugin files to the /wp-content/plugins/firedrum-email-marketing directory, or install the plugin through the WordPress plugins screen directly.
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ screen in WordPress.
  3. Enter your API Key on the FireDrum Setup screen.
  4. You’re Done!
sections.faq:
What is FireDrum?

FireDrum is one of the leading email marketing providers to organizations around the world. FireDrum’s email marketing is easy to use and full of features to help you manage your contacts, campaigns, and track the results using state of the art reporting and anaylytics.

Still not sure if FireDrum is right for you? Learn more on our website!

What is the cost involved?

This plugin is completely free. Sign up for a FREE account today!
sections.changelog:
1.60

Fix an issue that prevents the plugin from completing cleanup during uninstallation.

1.59

Fix an issue with the Gravity Forms integration wherein contacts may be added to unselected lists.
Fix an issue with the Divi / Bloom integration that prevented the use of custom fields.

1.58

Fix WordPress plugin signup notifications.
Allow for double opt-in and system signup notifications.

1.57

Follow SEO best practices! ðŸ™‚

1.56

Fix an issue wherein WooCommerce Abandoned Cart emails might not send.

1.55

Add support for “select” and “radio button” custom field types.

1.54

Add Gravity Forms integration.

1.53

Fix an issue wherein unpublished Modal forms may appear on the site.
Fix an issue wherein WooCommerce Abandoned Cart emails might not send.

1.52

Fix an issue wherein the popup form close button was not visible under certain conditions.

1.51

Fix an issue wherein admin notices were not being displayed properly.

1.50

Fix an issue in the update routine.

1.49

Fix broken popup close button in IE.

1.48

Security fixes and stability improvements.

1.47

Fix compatibility with PHP versions 5.4, 5.5, and 5.6.

1.46

Add the ability to define multiple forms!
Add WooCommerce integration: Display Sign-Up Forms on the checkout page and add the ability to send Abandoned Cart emails.
Fix Divi / Bloom integration.

1.45

Add the ability to turn off new signup email notifications.

1.44

Add “Clear API Cache” functionality.

1.43

Fix a bug with Bloom integration not appearing in the list of Email Providers.
Added ‘firedrum-email-marketing_bloom_subscribe’ filter; useful if you need to do something with subscription data before it is sent to FireDrum.

1.42

Fix a bug with Bloom integration potentially causing PHP errors.

1.41

Fix missing second parameter to plugins_url. Thanks to Nathan K. for the detailed bug report!

1.40

Make the options for custom styles and border colors easier to understand.

1.39

Fix infinite recursion issue in the main plugin instantiator.

1.38

Fix a bug wherein the values of custom fields of type Date may not be saved.
Fix a bug wherein certain email notifications may be sent in plain text instead of HTML.
API performance improvements.

1.37

API performance improvements.

1.36

Fix bug in firedrum_api.class.php.

1.35

Lower the minimum required PHP version to 5.0.0.
Add Bloom opt-in plugin integration.

1.34

Support the new Firedrum Captcha API. No longer depends on BWS Captcha.

1.32

Switch to WP HTTP API.

1.31

Added captcha support

1.30

Fix for WordPress system emails being filtered globally.

1.29

Updated icon

1.28

Added Icon

1.27

Fixed typo

1.26

Fixed typo

1.25

Added API error responses back to user page

1.24

Enabling the honeypot configuration option now functions as intended.

1.21

Added support for honeypot antispam.
